item.title: 苹果推出人工智能的时间过于交错，难以刺激 iPhone 的 "超级周期
item.description: 苹果公司的人工智能功能不断推迟推出，这很可能意味着 iPhone 16 不会出现 "超级周期 "订单。还有：周一 iPhone 16 发布会的一切期待；Sonos 因面临应用程序危机而推迟推出 Roku 风格产品；iPhone 16 上市第二天，苹果可能被罚款数十亿美元。【原文：Apple’s AI features keep getting delayed — and that slow rollout likely means that the iPhone 16 won’t see a “super cycle” of orders. Also: Everything to expect from the phone’s launch event on Monday; Sonos delays its Roku-style product as it contends with an app crisis; and Apple could be fined billions the day after the iPhone 16 debut.】

item.title: 9 月借贷狂潮凸显新兴市场恐慌情绪
item.description: 发展中国家的借款人正在加强防御，以应对可能动摇其最大的美国市场并破坏再融资计划的波动。【原文：Borrowers in the developing world are shoring up their defenses against volatility that could shake their biggest markets in the US and derail refinancing plans.】

item.title: 桑坦德银行命令英国员工每周三天返回办公室
item.description: 桑坦德银行（Banco Santander SA）的英国员工将不得不每周在办公室度过相当于三天的时间，因为这家西班牙银行禁止远程办公。【原文：Banco Santander SA’s UK employees will have to spend the equivalent of three days a week in the office, as the Spanish-owned bank clamps down on remote working.】

item.title: 据《Il Sole》报道，意大利明年经济增长目标为 1.3%-1.4
item.description: 据《Il Sole 24 Ore》报报道，意大利明年的经济增长目标为 1.3%-1.4%，但该报并未说明从何处获得这一信息。【原文：Italy is targeting economic growth of 1.3%-1.4% next year, Il Sole 24 Ore newspaper reported, without saying where it got the information.】

item.title: 欧洲奢侈品股的 2400 亿美元之路才刚刚开始
item.description: 近几个月来，欧洲奢侈品公司的市值遭受了近 25 万亿美元的重创，随着中国经济衰退的加剧，它们在股市上的影响力可能会进一步减弱。【原文：After enduring almost a quarter-trillion dollar hit to their market value in recent months, Europe’s luxury firms may see their stock-market clout wane further as China’s downturn worsens.】

item.title: 伊朗否认向俄罗斯提供弹道导弹的报道
item.description: 伊朗否认向俄罗斯提供弹道导弹的报道，称伊朗没有向俄乌战争中的任何一方提供军事支持。【原文：Iran denied reports it supplied Russia with ballistic missiles, saying it doesn’t provide military support to either side in the Russia-Ukraine war.】

item.title: 泰国新总理巴吞吞将优先解决 4740 亿美元的家庭债务问题
item.description: 泰国新政府计划加快全面的债务重组，以解决约 4,740 亿美元的家庭债务，为小企业提供财政援助，并加快财政刺激措施以促进经济增长。【原文：Thailand’s new government plans to expedite a sweeping debt restructuring to tackle an estimated $474 billion of household liability, offer financial assistance to small businesses and accelerate fiscal stimulus to lift growth.】

item.title: 中国进一步向外资开放医疗保健行业
item.description: 中国宣布了一系列进一步向外国投资者开放医疗保健行业的政策，为振兴世界第二大经济体的努力添砖加瓦。【原文：China announced a slew of policies to further open up its health care sector to foreign investors, adding to efforts to revive the world’s second-biggest economy.】

item.title: 新加坡将于 2025 年开始建设樟宜 T5 大型机场航站楼
item.description: 新加坡总理黄遵宪表示，新加坡将于明年上半年开始在樟宜机场建设一个新的大型航站楼，目标是将这个航空枢纽的年旅客吞吐量提高一半以上。【原文：Singapore will start construction of a new mega terminal at Changi Airport in the first half of next year, aiming to lift the aviation hub’s annual passenger handling capacity by more than half, Prime Minister Lawrence Wong said.】

item.title: 新加坡的石油派对被油价下跌和中国阴霾破坏
item.description: 石油狂欢还未结束；但对于本周聚集在新加坡参加会谈和屋顶鸡尾酒会的顶级商人和高管来说，近年来超额利润带来的亢奋情绪正在迅速消退。【原文：The oil party isn’t over yet — but for top merchants and executives gathering for talks and rooftop cocktails in Singapore this week, the exuberance that came with the outsized profits of recent years is quickly fading.】

item.title: 特朗普承诺对避开美元的国家征收 "100%关税
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周六承诺，将使各国放弃使用美元的成本过高，这为他的关税政纲增添了新的支柱。【原文：Donald Trump pledged on Saturday to make it too costly for countries to shift away from using the US dollar, adding a new pillar to his tariff platform.】

item.title: 欧洲央行准备再次降息为美联储热身
item.description: 随着全球货币周期向更同步的宽松政策倾斜，欧洲央行可能会在周四降息，为下周美国的降息行动做铺垫。【原文：The European Central Bank will probably cut interest rates on Thursday in a prelude to a US move the following week, as the global monetary cycle tilts toward more synchronized easing.】

item.title: 信用周报》：CLO 权益持有人重置交易的速度创下新高
item.description: 由于有史以来最大规模的重置浪潮，抵押贷款债务中风险最高部分的投资者正看到他们的回报得到提高。【原文：Investors in the riskiest portions of collateralized loan obligations are seeing their returns get juiced thanks to the biggest wave of resetting on record.】

item.title: 耶伦表示欢迎中国同行来访
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）表示，她欢迎中国财政部长访问美国，并对她本人再次访问中国持开放态度，她强调了世界上两个最大经济体相互接触的重要性。【原文：Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said that she would welcome a visit to the US by her Chinese counterpart, and is open to another visit of her own to China, as she underscored the importance of the world’s two largest economies engaging with each other.】

item.title: 意大利希望撤销欧盟 2035 年内燃机禁令计划
item.description: 意大利能源部长表示，应重新审议欧盟关于从 2035 年起禁止销售新型内燃机的有效禁令。【原文：Italy’s energy minister said the European Union’s effective ban on sales of new internal combustion engines from 2035 should be reviewed.】

item.title: 伊拉克开始联合循环项目工作，将增加 614 兆瓦：总理办公室
item.description: 伊拉克总理穆罕默德-希亚-苏达尼（Mohammed Shia Al-Sudani）在巴格达的一次电视直播活动中说，四台联合循环机组的开工典礼将为国家电网增加总计 614 兆瓦的电力，并有助于减少该国的天然气进口。【原文：Iraqi Prime Minister Mohammed Shia Al-Sudani inaugurated work on four combined cycle units that will add a total of 614MW of power to the national grid and help reduce the country’s imports of gas, he said in a televised event in Baghdad.】

item.title: 葡萄牙呼吁欧盟开始为乌克兰加入欧盟做准备
item.description: 葡萄牙正在积极游说乌克兰加入欧盟，并希望欧盟开始为乌克兰最终加入欧盟做准备。【原文：Portugal is actively lobbying for Ukraine to join the European Union and wants the bloc to begin preparing for its eventual inclusion.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克支持特朗普的 PAC 加大广告力度：我们必须阻止卡马拉
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的美国政治行动委员会（America PAC）开始启动数字广告活动，支持唐纳德-特朗普竞选总统。到目前为止，这些信息主要针对摇摆州的选民，而且并不含蓄。【原文：Elon Musk’s America PAC is starting to fire up its digital ad campaign in support of Donald Trump’s presidential bid. The messages so far have been targeted at swing-state voters — and are anything but subtle.】

item.title: 意大利高官称今年仍有信心实现 1%的增长
item.description: 意大利政府相信今年的经济增长率将达到 1%，这是总理乔治亚-梅洛尼（Giorgia Meloni）履行其对欧盟减债承诺的关键指标。【原文：Italy’s government is confident economic growth will reach 1% this year, a crucial gauge for Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni to fulfill her debt-cut commitments with the European Union.】

item.title: 泵价下跌削弱了特朗普对哈里斯的通胀攻击
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）试图通过攻击卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）在能源方面的记录来激怒对通货膨胀感到厌倦的消费者之际，稳步下降的汽油价格为美国副总统卡马拉-哈里斯竞选美国最高职位提供了顺风。【原文：Steadily falling gasoline prices are providing a tailwind for US Vice President Kamala Harris’ campaign for the nation’s highest office as Donald Trump seeks to rile inflation-weary consumers by attacking her record on energy.】

item.title: Byju的审计师BDO在破产程序中辞职
item.description: 陷入困境的教育科技初创公司 Byju's 表示，其审计师 BDO 辞职，成为自 2023 年中期以来第二家辞职的公司。【原文：Troubled education tech startup Byju’s said its auditor BDO resigned, becoming the second such company to do so since mid-2023.】

item.title: 泰国新总理将推进现金刺激政策以重振经济
item.description: 泰国新上任的总理白通丹-西那瓦（Paetongtarn Shinawatra）在其内阁敲定蓝图，将东南亚第二大经济体从长期低增长和长期家庭债务中解脱出来时，誓言要推进一项有争议的 140 亿美元现金刺激计划。【原文：Thailand’s newly-appointed Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra vowed to push ahead with a controversial $14 billion cash stimulus plan as her cabinet finalized a blueprint to free Southeast Asia’s second-largest economy from a prolonged period of low growth and chronic household debt.】

item.title: 自动化小型超市可能颠覆德国商店关闭法
item.description: 对许多人来说，在德国生活的一个特别令人烦恼的方面是，几乎不可能在周日或公共节假日买到日用品。自 1956 年以来，国家法律规定几乎所有的商店都要在这些日子关门，虽然联邦各州现在可以自行决定自己的规定，但大多数州都坚持认为，工人和购物者都需要一个法定的休息日。【原文：For many people, a particularly vexing aspect of life in Germany is that it’s nearly impossible to buy groceries on Sundays or public holidays. Since 1956, national law has dictated that almost every store close on those days, and although federal states can now decide their own rules, most have held firm to the idea that workers and shoppers need a mandated day off.】

item.title: 中央银行行长告诉 NZZ，瑞银应提高资本水平
item.description: 瑞士国家银行行长托马斯-乔丹（Thomas Jordan）告诉《新苏黎世报》（Neue Zuercher Zeitung），瑞银集团应预留更多资本。【原文：UBS Group AG should set aside more capital, Swiss National Bank President Thomas Jordan told Neue Zuercher Zeitung.】

item.title: 中国人民银行在黄金价格创下历史新高时继续暂停购买黄金
item.description: 由于贵金属价格创下历史新高，中国央行 8 月份连续第四个月没有增加黄金储备。【原文：China’s central bank did not add any gold to its reserves for a fourth straight month in August as prices for the precious metal rose to a record.】

item.title: 新加坡将于 2025 年上半年开始建设大型机场航站楼：ST
item.description: 据《海峡时报》援引新加坡总理黄遵宪的话报道，新加坡将于明年上半年开始在樟宜机场建设一个新的大型航站楼，旨在将这个航空枢纽的年旅客吞吐量再提高 5000 万人次。【原文：Singapore will start construction of a new mega terminal at its Changi Airport in the first half of next year, aiming to lift the aviation hub’s annual passenger handling capacity by another 50 million, the Straits Times reported, citing Prime Minister Lawrence Wong.】

item.title: 新加坡航空公司飞往中国的 Scoot 航班上有七人受伤：ST
item.description: 据《海峡时报》（Straits Times）周六报道，新加坡航空公司（Singapore Airlines Ltd.）旗下廉价航空公司 Scoot 运营的一架飞机周五在从新加坡飞往中国广州的途中遭遇乱流，造成七人受伤，其中一人住院治疗。【原文：Seven people were injured, with one hospitalized after a plane operated by Singapore Airlines Ltd.’s budget carrier Scoot encountered turbulence during a flight from the city state to Guangzhou in China on Friday, the Straits Times reported on Saturday.】

item.title: 美国最快将于本月提出银行资本规则修订案
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，美联储和其他监管机构正准备对一系列拟议的银行资本规则进行大刀阔斧的修改，以克服来自银行业的顽强抵抗。【原文：The Federal Reserve and other regulators are poised to unveil sweeping changes to a slate of proposed capital rules for banks as they seek to overcome tough resistance from the industry, according to people familiar to the matter.】

item.title: 中国多头厌倦了等待难以实现的股市复苏
item.description: 中国股市的疲软正在削弱华尔街一些最坚定支持者的信心，世界第二大经济体出现转机的希望正在破灭。【原文：Weakness in Chinese equities is eroding the confidence of some of Wall Street’s staunchest supporters, with hopes for a turnaround fading in the world’s No. 2 economy.】

item.title: 美国警告在港企业面临更高的法律风险
item.description: 美国拜登政府周五发布警报称，在香港经营的企业可能触犯国家安全法律，并面临更高的法律和监管风险，包括违反美国制裁。【原文：The US said businesses operating in Hong Kong could fall afoul of national security legislation and also faced heightened legal and regulatory risks — including violating US sanctions — in an alert issued by the Biden administration on Friday.】
